Package de.dedede.model.persistence.daos

Class MediumDao

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dedede.model.persistence.daos.MediumDao
  • public final class MediumDao
extends java.lang.Object
    This DAO (data access object) manages data pertaining to a medium or a copy. A medium describes general library entities, of which several copies may exist. Specifically, this DAO implements the CRUD methods (create, read, update, delete) for both media and medium-copies. See the MediumDto and CopyDto classes for the used DTOs.

    • Method Detail

      • createMedium

        public static void createMedium​(MediumDto mediumDto)
                         throws EntityInstanceNotUniqueException
        Enters new medium data into the persistent data store. Any copies associated with this medium are not entered automatically. The enclosed ID must not be associated with an existing data entry in the data store. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        mediumDto - A DTO container with the new medium data
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceNotUniqueException - Is thrown when the enclosed ID is already associated with an existing data entry.
        See Also:
        MediumDto

      • readMedium

        public static MediumDto readMedium​(long id)
                            throws EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException
        Fetches a medium from the persistent data store using an ID. The ID must be associated with an existing data entry. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        A DTO container with the medium data referenced by the ID.
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException - Is thrown when the passed ID is not associated with any existing data entry.

      • readMediaBySearchCriteria

        public static PaginatedList readMediaBySearchCriteria​(PaginationDto paginationDetails)
        Fetches a paged list of media from the persistent data store, for which search filters are applied to the name first. The order of the data and concurrent read/write behavior in the underlying data store is unspecified.
        Parameters:
        paginationDetails - A container for the search terms, page size, and page number.
        Returns:
        A paginated list of DTO containers with the medium data.
        See Also:
        MediumDto

      • updateMedium

        public static void updateMedium​(MediumDto mediumDto)
                         throws EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException
        Overwrites existing medium data in the persistent data store. The enclosed ID must be present in the data store and is used to identify and remove existing data. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        mediumDto - A DTO container with the overwriting data
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException - Is thrown if the passed ID isn't associated with any data entry.
        See Also:
        MediumDto

      • deleteMedium

        public static MediumDto deleteMedium​(long id)
                              throws EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException
        Deletes existing medium data in the persistent data store referenced by an id. This ID must be present in the data store and is used to remove existing data. Otherwise, an exception is thrown
        Parameters:
        id - An ID that refers to the medium to be deleted.
        Returns:
        A DTO container with the deleted medium data.
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException - Is thrown if the passed ID isn't associated with any data entry.
        See Also:
        MediumDto

        public static void createCopy​(CopyDto copyDto)
                       throws EntityInstanceNotUniqueException

        Parameters:
        copyDto - A DTO container with the overwriting data
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceNotUniqueException - Is thrown if the passed ID is already associated with a data entry.
        See Also:
        CopyDto

      • readCopy

        public static CopyDto readCopy​(java.lang.String signature)
        Fetches a medium-copy, identified by its signature, from the persistent data store. The passed signature must be associated with an existing data entry in the data store. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        signature - The medium-copy signature, which identifies the specific medium-copy.
        Returns:
        A DTO container with the medium-copy data for the given signature.
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException - Is thrown if the passed signature isn't associated with any data entry.
        See Also:
        CopyDto

      • readAllOverdueCopies

        public static PaginatedList readAllOverdueCopies​(PaginationDto paginationDetails)
        Fetches a paginated list of all overdue medium-copies from the persistent data store. The list contains overdue material from all users, globally.
        Parameters:
        paginationDetails - A container for the page size and number.
        Returns:
        A paginated list of DTO containers with the medium-copy data.
        See Also:
        CopyDto

      • readAllCopiesFromMedium

        public static PaginatedList readAllCopiesFromMedium​(long mediumId,
                                                    PaginationDto paginationDetails)
        Fetches a paginated list of all medium-copies belonging to a specific medium from the persistent data store.
        Parameters:
        mediumId - An identifier for a medium, for which the copies are being queried.
        paginationDetails - A container for the page size and number.
        Returns:
        A list of DTO containers with the medium-copy data for the given medium-id.
        See Also:
        CopyDto

      • deleteCopy

        public static CopyDto deleteCopy​(java.lang.String signature)
        Deletes existing medium-copy data in the persistent data store. The enclosed signature must be associated with an existing entry and is used to identify and remove data. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        signature - A signature that identifies the medium-copy to be deleted
        Returns:
        A DTO container with the deleted medium-copy data.
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException - Is thrown if the signature isn't associated with any data entry.
        See Also:
        CopyDto

      • lendCopy

        public static void lendCopy​(java.lang.String copySignature,
                            long userId)
                     throws EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException
        Registers that a specific medium-copy has been checked out by a specific user. Until it is returned, it is unavailable to other users.
        Parameters:
        copySignature - A signature that refers to the medium-copy.
        userId - An ID that refers to the user.
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException - Is thrown when the either the medium-copy is currently checked out or when either entity doesn't exist in the data store.
        See Also:
        CopyDto

      • returnCopy

        public static void returnCopy​(java.lang.String copySignature,
                              long userId)
                       throws EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException
        Registers that a specific medium-copy has been returned by a specific user. It is then available to other users for check-out.
        Parameters:
        copySignature - A signature that refers to the medium-copy.
        userId - An ID that refers to the user.
        Throws:
        EntityInstanceDoesNotExistException - Is thrown when either the medium-copy hasn't been checked out by the given user or either entity doesn't exist in the data store.
        See Also:
        CopyDto
